intro: Muhlenbergia breviseta, commonly known as the short-haired muhlenbergia, is a perennial grass native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, bluish-green foliage. The plant produces panicles of small, pale green to golden brown flowers in late summer to early fall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established. Muhlenbergia breviseta is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
